requirement: Section 302 mandates that corporate officers certify that the company's financial statements comply with SEC requirements.
title: Corporate Officer Certification
description: Corporate officers, typically the CFO or CEO, must certify that the company's financial statements comply with SEC requirements.
testing_procedures: Verify that the CFO or CEO has signed off on the financial statements.
Check for documentation of compliance with SEC requirements.
remediation:
Ensure corporate officers are aware of and comply with certification requirements.
Educate corporate officers on the importance of certification.
Implement a review process for financial statements before certification.

requirement: Section 401 states that financial statements are accurate and prepared following GAAP accounting standards.
title: Financial Statement Accuracy
description: Financial statements must be accurate and prepared following GAAP accounting standards, including any off-balance-sheet transactions.
testing_procedures: Review financial statements for compliance with GAAP standards.
Check for inclusion of off-balance-sheet transactions.
remediation:
Ensure financial statements are accurate and GAAP-compliant.
Conduct regular audits of financial statements.
Implement controls to capture off-balance-sheet transactions.

requirement: Section 404 requires that management and auditors set internal controls and reporting procedures.
title: Internal Controls and Reporting Procedures
description: Management and auditors must set internal controls and reporting procedures to ensure the adequacy of the controls.
testing_procedures: Evaluate the design and effectiveness of internal controls.
remediation:
Establish and maintain effective internal controls and reporting procedures.
Design internal controls tailored to the company's operations.
Regularly review and update reporting procedures.

requirement: Section 802 includes three rules impacting recordkeeping: destruction and falsification of records, retention periods, and required records storage.
title: Recordkeeping Rules
description: Includes rules on the destruction and falsification of records, retention periods, and required records storage.
testing_procedures: Verify compliance with record retention policies.
Check for procedures preventing unauthorized destruction of records.
remediation:
Ensure compliance with recordkeeping rules.
Implement a record retention policy.
Train employees on proper recordkeeping practices.

requirement: Implement access controls to prevent users without proper authorization and credentials from accessing sensitive data, systems, and transactions.
title: Access Controls and Segregation of Duties
description: Access controls like Segregation of Duties (SoD) prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data, systems, and transactions.
testing_procedures: Verify that access controls are in place and functioning as intended.
Review identity governance solutions and physical measures for effectiveness.
remediation:
Ensure proper access controls are implemented and regularly reviewed.
Implement identity governance solutions.
Restrict access to sensitive areas and systems.
Regularly review access logs and credentials.
